column4: I would be happy to tell you how I remotely log in to my headless box if that would be of some use.
yes
aye?
Is that a request for more info, or are you not understanding what I am telling you?
I dont understand what you said.
ok, i think I am trying to do something totally different to that.
What are you trying to accomplish?
seamlessrdp lets you in simplest terms connect to a window in windows instead of an rdp session so you would rdp to your windows machine and specify notepad and a notepad window would open in *nux.
or http://www.cendio.com/seamlessrdp/
I can tell you how to do that in reverse of what you are saying.
what would the reverse be?
ok so how would I have windows(tm) windows in X?
most everything I can find has one utilizing *nix from windows.  Give me a second though.
thats what I can currently do, but what I am trying to do here is rdp to *only* an IE window or *only* an Outlook window, so its like a native linux program.
That is the best I can do to help you.  I can get things set up to do it in reverse, but know of no way to do it the way you would like.
where is that?
hey it kind of worked
here http://linux.about.com/od/itl_guide/a/gdeitl76t05.htm
What kind of worked?
ive got a notepad window open infront of xchat
but I have two spare windows and windows in the background of my two screens
getting there.
